body: Please also include an example that behaves unexpectedly.

@untitaker I provided one in the merge request... but I'll re-paste here as well.

Currently an option defined as...
```python
@click.option('--ambitious', '--all', '-a', is_flag=True)
```
...will target `all` instead of `ambitious`

I get an error `TypeError: batch() got an unexpected keyword argument 'all'`
When will Click 6.8 be released? I discovered this bug independently, but the fix hasn't been released yet.

issue.title: Error with python-click > 6.7

repository.name: gandi.cli
repository.description: âš  ARCHIVED - Command line interface to Gandi.net products using the public API

issue.body:
On Debian buster, with a release 1.2 installed and python-click in a version 6.7+git20180829-1 (pre 6.8), the GANDI CLI throw error on bg parameter for some command.

```
$ gandi vm stop beasdie2
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/gandi", line 11, in <module>
    load_entry_point('gandi.cli==1.2', 'console_scripts', 'gandi')()
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/gandi/cli/__main__.py", line 8, in main
    cli(obj={})
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/click/core.py", line 758, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/click/core.py", line 713, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/gandi/cli/core/cli.py", line 162, in invoke
    click.Group.invoke(self, ctx)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/click/core.py", line 1131, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/click/core.py", line 1131, in invoke
    return _process_result(sub_ctx.command.invoke(sub_ctx))
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/click/core.py", line 950, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/click/core.py", line 551, in invoke
    return callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/click/decorators.py", line 64, in new_func
    return ctx.invoke(f, obj, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/click/core.py", line 551, in invoke
    return callback(*args, **kwargs)
TypeError: stop() got an unexpected keyword argument 'bg'
```
The same command is working fine with the same release of gandi.cli (1.2) and python-click 6.7 in a virtualenv.

Could be related to https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/793 which change default in handling the long and short parameters in python-click.

issue.title: click versions available: 7.0

repository.name: elm-doc
repository.description: Generate static documentation of your Elm project.

issue.body:
There are new versions of click available from pypi.

## 7.0

Released 2018-09-25

-   Drop support for Python 2.6 and 3.3.
    ([\#967](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/967),
    [\#976](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/976))
-   Wrap `click.Choice`\'s missing message.
    ([\#202](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/202),
    [\#1000](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1000))
-   Add native ZSH autocompletion support.
    ([\#323](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/323),
    [\#865](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/865))
-   Document that ANSI color info isn\'t parsed from bytearrays in
    Python 2. ([\#334](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/334))
-   Document byte-stripping behavior of `CliRunner`.
    ([\#334](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/334),
    [\#1010](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1010))
-   Usage errors now hint at the `--help` option.
    ([\#393](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/393),
    [\#557](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/557))
-   Implement streaming pager.
    ([\#409](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/409),
    [\#889](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/889))
-   Extract bar formatting to its own method.
    ([\#414](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/414))
-   Add `DateTime` type for converting input in given date time formats.
    ([\#423](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/423))
-   `secho`\'s first argument can now be `None`, like in `echo`.
    ([\#424](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/424))
-   Fixes a `ZeroDivisionError` in `ProgressBar.make_step`, when the arg
    passed to the first call of `ProgressBar.update` is 0.
    ([\#447](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/447),
    [\#1012](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1012))
-   Show progressbar only if total execution time is visible.
    ([\#487](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/487))
-   Added the ability to hide commands and options from help.
    ([\#500](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/500))
-   Document that options can be `required=True`.
    ([\#514](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/514),
    [\#1022](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1022))
-   Non-standalone calls to `Context.exit` return the exit code, rather
    than calling `sys.exit`.
    ([\#533](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/533),
    [\#667](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/667),
    [\#1098](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1098))
-   `click.getchar()` returns Unicode in Python 3 on Windows, consistent
    with other platforms.
    ([\#537](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/537),
    [\#821](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/821),
    [\#822](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/822),
    [\#1088](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/1088),
    [\#1108](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1108))
-   Added `FloatRange` type.
    ([\#538](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/538),
    [\#553](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/553))
-   Added support for bash completion of `type=click.Choice` for
    `Options` and `Arguments`.
    ([\#535](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/535),
    [\#681](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/681))
-   Only allow one positional arg for `Argument` parameter declaration.
    ([\#568](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/568),
    [\#574](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/574),
    [\#1014](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1014))
-   Add `case_sensitive=False` as an option to Choice.
    ([\#569](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/569))
-   `click.getchar()` correctly raises `KeyboardInterrupt` on \"\^C\"
    and `EOFError` on \"\^D\" on Linux.
    ([\#583](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/583),
    [\#1115](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1115))
-   Fix encoding issue with `click.getchar(echo=True)` on Linux.
    ([\#1115](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1115))
-   `param_hint` in errors now derived from param itself.
    ([\#598](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/598),
    [\#704](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/704),
    [\#709](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/709))
-   Add a test that ensures that when an argument is formatted into a
    usage error, its metavar is used, not its name.
    ([\#612](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/612))
-   Allow setting `prog_name` as extra in `CliRunner.invoke`.
    ([\#616](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/616),
    [\#999](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/999))
-   Help text taken from docstrings truncates at the `\f` form feed
    character, useful for hiding Sphinx-style parameter documentation.
    ([\#629](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/629),
    [\#1091](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1091))
-   `launch` now works properly under Cygwin.
    ([\#650](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/650))
-   Update progress after iteration.
    ([\#651](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/651),
    [\#706](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/706))
-   `CliRunner.invoke` now may receive `args` as a string representing a
    Unix shell command.
    ([\#664](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/664))
-   Make `Argument.make_metavar()` default to type metavar.
    ([\#675](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/675))
-   Add documentation for `ignore_unknown_options`.
    ([\#684](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/684))
-   Add bright colors support for `click.style` and fix the reset option
    for parameters `fg` and `bg`.
    ([\#703](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/703),
    [\#809](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/809))
-   Add `show_envvar` for showing environment variables in help.
    ([\#710](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/710))
-   Avoid `BrokenPipeError` during interpreter shutdown when stdout or
    stderr is a closed pipe.
    ([\#712](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/712),
    [\#1106](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1106))
-   Document customizing option names.
    ([\#725](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/725),
    [\#1016](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1016))
-   Disable `sys._getframes()` on Python interpreters that don\'t
    support it. ([\#728](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/728))
-   Fix bug in test runner when calling `sys.exit` with `None`.
    ([\#739](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/739))
-   Clarify documentation on command line options.
    ([\#741](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/741),
    [\#1003](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1003))
-   Fix crash on Windows console.
    ([\#744](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/744))
-   Fix bug that caused bash completion to give improper completions on
    chained commands.
    ([\#754](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/754),
    [\#774](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/774))
-   Added support for dynamic bash completion from a user-supplied
    callback. ([\#755](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/755))
-   Added support for bash completions containing spaces.
    ([\#773](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/773))
-   Allow autocompletion function to determine whether or not to return
    completions that start with the incomplete argument.
    ([\#790](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/790),
    [\#806](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/806))
-   Fix option naming routine to match documentation and be
    deterministic.
    ([\#793](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/793),
    [\#794](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/794))
-   Fix path validation bug.
    ([\#795](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/795),
    [\#1020](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1020))
-   Add test and documentation for `Option` naming: functionality.
    ([\#799](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/799))
-   Update doc to match arg name for `path_type`.
    ([\#801](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/801))
-   Raw strings added so correct escaping occurs.
    ([\#807](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/807))
-   Fix 16k character limit of `click.echo` on Windows.
    ([\#816](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/816),
    [\#819](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/819))
-   Overcome 64k character limit when writing to binary stream on
    Windows 7. ([\#825](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/825),
    [\#830](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/830))
-   Add bool conversion for \"t\" and \"f\".
    ([\#842](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/842))
-   `NoSuchOption` errors take `ctx` so that `--help` hint gets printed
    in error output.
    ([\#860](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/860))
-   Fixed the behavior of Click error messages with regards to Unicode
    on 2.x and 3.x. Message is now always Unicode and the str and
    Unicode special methods work as you expect on that platform.
    ([\#862](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/862))
-   Progress bar now uses stderr by default.
    ([\#863](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/863))
-   Add support for auto-completion documentation.
    ([\#866](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/866),
    [\#869](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/869))
-   Allow `CliRunner` to separate stdout and stderr.
    ([\#868](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/868))
-   Fix variable precedence.
    ([\#873](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/873),
    [\#874](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/874))
-   Fix invalid escape sequences.
    ([\#877](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/877))
-   Fix `ResourceWarning` that occurs during some tests.
    ([\#878](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/878))
-   When detecting a misconfigured locale, don\'t fail if the `locale`
    command fails. ([\#880](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/880))
-   Add `case_sensitive=False` as an option to `Choice` types.
    ([\#887](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/887))
-   Force stdout/stderr writable. This works around issues with badly
    patched standard streams like those from Jupyter.
    ([\#918](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/918))
-   Fix completion of subcommand options after last argument
    ([\#919](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/919),
    [\#930](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/930))
-   `_AtomicFile` now uses the `realpath` of the original filename so
    that changing the working directory does not affect it.
    ([\#920](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/920))
-   Fix incorrect completions when defaults are present
    ([\#925](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/925),
    [\#930](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/930))
-   Add copy option attrs so that custom classes can be re-used.
    ([\#926](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/926),
    [\#994](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/994))
-   \"x\" and \"a\" file modes now use stdout when file is `"-"`.
    ([\#929](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/929))
-   Fix missing comma in `__all__` list.
    ([\#935](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/935))
-   Clarify how parameters are named.
    ([\#949](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/949),
    [\#1009](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1009))
-   Stdout is now automatically set to non blocking.
    ([\#954](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/954))
-   Do not set options twice.
    ([\#962](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/962))
-   Move `fcntl` import.
    ([\#965](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/965))
-   Fix Google App Engine `ImportError`.
    ([\#995](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/995))
-   Better handling of help text for dynamic default option values.
    ([\#996](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/996))
-   Fix `get_winter_size()` so it correctly returns `(0,0)`.
    ([\#997](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/997))
-   Add test case checking for custom param type.
    ([\#1001](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1001))
-   Allow short width to address cmd formatting.
    ([\#1002](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1002))
-   Add details about Python version support.
    ([\#1004](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1004))
-   Added deprecation flag to commands.
    ([\#1005](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1005))
-   Fixed issues where `fd` was undefined.
    ([\#1007](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1007))
-   Fix formatting for short help.
    ([\#1008](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1008))
-   Document how `auto_envvar_prefix` works with command groups.
    ([\#1011](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1011))
-   Don\'t add newlines by default for progress bars.
    ([\#1013](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1013))
-   Use Python sorting order for ZSH completions.
    ([\#1047](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1047),
    [\#1059](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1059))
-   Document that parameter names are converted to lowercase by default.
    ([\#1055](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1055))
-   Subcommands that are named by the function now automatically have
    the underscore replaced with a dash. If you register a function
    named `my_command` it becomes `my-command` in the command line
    interface.
-   Hide hidden commands and options from completion.
    ([\#1058](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1058),
    [\#1061](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1061))
-   Fix absolute import blocking Click from being vendored into a
    project on Windows.
    ([\#1068](https://github.com/pallets/click/issues/1068),
    [\#1069](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1069))
-   Fix issue where a lowercase `auto_envvar_prefix` would not be
    converted to uppercase.
    ([\#1105](https://github.com/pallets/click/pull/1105))

issue.title: Longest option argument not used as internal/variable name

repository.name: click
repository.description: Python composable command line interface toolkit

issue.body:
It seems that with 7.0 the longest option argument isn't being used as the internal and variable name.

https://github.com/pallets/click/blob/2c622eed402c64e1645db3904c2410f6c05fbf19/docs/parameters.rst#L93-L95
> the internal name is generated automatically by taking the longest argument

```python3
import click
import click.testing


print(click.__version__)

@click.command()
@click.option(
    '--temp',
    '--temporary',
    'temporary',
)
def good(temporary):
    pass


@click.command()
@click.option(
    '--temp',
    '--temporary',
)
def bad(temporary):
    pass


def click_runner(command):
    print(command.name)
    runner = click.testing.CliRunner()
    result = runner.invoke(
        command,
        [],
        catch_exceptions=False,
    )
    print(result.output)

click_runner(command=good)
click_runner(command=bad)

```
https://repl.it/@altendky/click-67-unexpected-keyword-argument-1
```python3
6.7
good

bad

```

https://repl.it/@altendky/click-70-unexpected-keyword-argument-1
```python3
7.0
good

bad
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "python", line 37, in <module>
  File "python", line 32, in click_runner
TypeError: bad() got an unexpected keyword argument 'temp'
```

https://repl.it/@altendky/click-2e856a5-unexpected-keyword-argument
```python3
7.0
good

bad
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "python", line 37, in <module>
  File "python", line 32, in click_runner
TypeError: bad() got an unexpected keyword argument 'temp'
```
